article_title: Chief Flynn on Crime and Protest
article_text:
Thanksgiving was quiet in Ferguson, Missouri after Governor Jay Nixon finally deployed enough National Guard troops to protect the public. The violence and looting that destroyed businesses were a disgrace, as were the media rationalizations for rioting in the wake of a grand jury decision not to indict police officer Darren Wilson.

Meanwhile, in Milwaukee last week, police chief Edward Flynn was asked about his encounter with protestors at a public hearing in response to an April police shooting. His passionate...

twitter.description: In Milwaukee, some blunt honesty about the real victims, writes the Wall Street Journal in an editorial.
